data.title: Sacred Buddha tooth relic at Sanam Luang from today
data.description: The public is being invited to pay respects to the sacred relic of the Buddha

data.title: M9 link to Nonthaburi is approved
data.description: The cabinet has approved the new 35km M9 motorway project linking Bangkok

data.title: New taxes for EVs
data.description: The national committee in charge of promoting the electric-vehicle (EV) industry has approved a new car tax structure to support the production of hybrid vehicles as part of a plan to convert internal combustion engines to electric power.

data.title: People's Party urges action to curb PM2.5
data.description: The People

data.title: Archaeologists examine Iron Age skeletons, pottery
data.description: Archaeologists are investigating the discovery of ancient human skeletons and pottery shards near the Sab Pradu Reservoir in Nakhon Ratchasima

data.title: More medicines made free for patients
data.description: The National Drug System Development Committee has added more drugs to the national list of essential medicines that patients can benefit from free of charge.

data.title: Sacred Buddha tooth relic at Sanam Luang from Thursday
data.description: The public is being invited to pay respects to the sacred relic of the Buddha

data.title: Ex-minister seen in Chiang Mai after release from prison
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Former commerce minister  Boonsong Teriyapirom  has been seen in public for the first time since his release on  parole  on Monday, after serving more than seven years in prison for corruption linked to the Yingluck Shinawatra governmentâ€™s  rice pledging  scheme.

data.title: Minister denies detention rule could favour Yingluck
data.description: Justice Minister Tawee Sodsong on Wednesday dismissed claims that a new regulation allowing for the  detention  of inmates outside prison would benefit fugitive former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra .

data.title: House panel raises border concerns
data.description: The House committee on  national security , border affairs, national strategy and national reform is planning to address border tension involving the  United Wa State Army  (UWSA) on Dec 13.

data.title: Minister to address dugong, seagrass crisis
data.description: Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Chalermchai Sri-on is scheduled to visit Trang on Saturday to assess the dugong population and the crisis of seagrass ecosystem degradation.

data.title: African sex traffickers arrested
data.description: Three Africans have been arrested on suspicion of being part of a gang known as "madam" that trafficks women from Africa into prostitution in Bangkok.

data.title: 1,000 arrests made in crackdown on proxies
data.description: More than 1,000 Thai and foreign nationals have been rounded up in a joint operation by police and commerce ministry authorities for the use of Thai  nominees  by foreign businesses over the past few weeks, authorities said on Wednesday.

data.title: Suvarnabhumi celebrates Unesco award for new terminal
data.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport  is celebrating its Prix Versailles award from  Unesco  for exceptional exterior design of its Midfield Satellite 1 ( SAT-1 ) terminal.

data.title: River tug towing barges crashes into moored boats
data.description: A  tugboat  pulling heavily  loaded barges  hit six moored  tour boats ,  sinking one  and injuring a woman, on the Chao Phraya River in Bangkok on Wednesday.

data.title: Funeral held for drowned Russian yoga 'influencer'
data.description: A funeral ceremony for a Russian woman swept out to sea while practising yoga sitting on a seaside rock last week was held on Koh Samui on Wednesday.

data.title: Brit arrested for alleged rape of 6-year-old stepdaughter
data.description: A Briton has been arrested in Pattaya for allegedly  raping his 6-year-old Thai stepdaughter  after  UK authorities  asked Thai police to  investigate a video  posted on social media.

data.title: Unesco lists Thai prawn soup Tom Yum Kung as humanityâ€™s intangible cultural heritage
data.description: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation early Wednesday morning listed Tom Yum Kung prawn soup as one of Thailandâ€™s intangible cultural heritage.

data.title: Unesco lists Thai prawn soup Tom Yum Kung as humanityâ€™s intangible cultural heritage
data.description: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation early Wednesday morning listed Tom Yum Kung prawn soup as one of Thailandâ€™s intangible cultural heritage.

data.title: Unesco experts to visit rail project in Ayutthaya soon
data.description: Experts from Unesco

data.title: Phuket cabaret seen as lucrative cash cow
data.description: Phuket cabaret is a "soft power" of the province that can generate over 200 million baht in revenue a year, according to provincial governor Sophon Suwanrat.

data.title: 4 Thais safe after Myanmar navy incident
data.description: Four Thai nationals detained in Myanmar remain safe after their boat allegedly strayed into Myanmar waters in the Andaman Sea on Saturday, the government said yesterday.

data.title: 40% of fathers smoke, survey shows
data.description: Almost four in ten fathers in Thailand smoke cigarettes, which mostly has a negative influence on their children, especially as more young people are now vaping while the average age of people who vape drops each year, according to new survey findings.

data.title: Govt plans new handout for farmers
data.description: The cabinet has approved a new programme to support over four million households which rely on agriculture across the country, which would see about 38.5 billion baht in financial assistance rolled out to replace the fertiliser co-payment scheme that was terminated by the government yesterday.

data.title: Cabinet okays B5bn budget for 16 more provinces
data.description: The cabinet yesterday approved a budget of five billion baht to assist households affected by flooding in 16 additional provinces, with similar payouts made to those previously impacted by floods.

data.title: Welfare boost for 3 vulnerable groups
data.description: Monthly allowance increases for newborn children, elderly and disabled people are expected to be implemented on Oct 1 next year, according to Varawut Silpa-archa, Minister of Social Development and Human Security (MSDHS).

data.title: Farmland to be confiscated
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat on Tuesday vowed that the agricultural land found to have been used unlawfully for operating Phu Nub Dao Farm in Saraburi will be confiscated.

data.title: Boonsong release stirs flap
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra denied speculation that the release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in an earlier rice-pledging scheme, would pave the way for the possible return of fugitive ex-premier Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Big haul of bullets seized from illegal migrants
data.description: KANCHANABURI: The arrest of nine  illegal migrants  from  Myanmar  has led to the discovery of almost 3,000  bullets  in a house in Muang district where they were staying, police said on Tuesday.

data.title: Transparency sought in Cambodia talks
data.description: The opposition Peopleâ€™s Party has called on the Thai government to ensure transparency in the appointment of a  joint technical committee  (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  over  disputed maritime areas .

data.title: Rainmaking flights give air quality instant boost
data.description: The  air quality index  (AQI) in Bangkok, its adjacent provinces and some northern provinces has reportedly i mproved  following the first day of  rainmaking flights  by the Department of Royal Rainmaking and Agricultural Aviation (DRRAA).

data.title: Government â€˜failing scam victimsâ€™
data.description: A Senate committee has blamed the government for failing to protect people from falling victim to investment  fraud  scams such as the one involving Dr   Boon Vanasin  , the founder of Thonburi Healthcare Group.

data.title: Fire guts 'ghost ship' on Koh Chang
data.description: A  fire  aboard an old, abandoned floating hotel known as the " ghost ship " sent black smoke billowing into the sky over the  resort island  of  Koh Chang , off the Trat coast, on Tuesday..
